title: Airdrops, Points, and Fake Agents: A Practical Safety Guide
keyQuestions: How do fake airdrop and points campaigns actually drain wallets?
What is the 60-second Source–Technical–Economics check before connecting a wallet?
Which wallet popups are immediate red flags (approvals, permits, SetApprovalForAll)?
How should I use a separate “claim” wallet so mistakes stay small?
How do I verify bots, mini-apps, and “admins” in Telegram safely?
What should I do right now if I already clicked or signed something suspicious?
quickSteps: Start only from an official announcement you can verify; match the domain letter-for-letter and avoid forwarded links.
Before you connect, run the three-screen check: Source, Technical ask, and Economics (rules and dates must be clear).
Reject broad permissions: SetApprovalForAll, IncreaseAllowance, “unlimited”, unclear permits, surprise chain/RPC switches.
Claim from a separate low-balance wallet; keep savings elsewhere and revoke new permissions on a weekly habit.
If something went wrong: revoke approvals/permits, move assets to a fresh address, save tx hashes, and warn others.

issueRouting.start: I want to claim points/airdrops but something feels off

branches.if: The link came from a forward, DM, or screenshot and you can’t trace it to the project’s official site
then: Do not connect your wallet or sign anything
Find the announcement on the project’s official site/verified socials and compare the domain letter-for-letter
If the domain or handle doesn’t match exactly, treat it as a scam and leave

branches.if: Your wallet asks for broad approvals or vague permits (SetApprovalForAll, IncreaseAllowance, unlimited)
then: Cancel the request immediately and close the page
Repeat the check using a separate low-balance claim wallet only
If you need to proceed, only sign narrow, time-bound actions tied to a verified contract

branches.if: You already clicked, connected, or signed something suspicious
then: Revoke recent approvals/permits as soon as possible
Move remaining assets to a fresh wallet address
Record tx hashes and timestamps for your notes and report the scam channel to your community

riskNotes: Most drainers don’t need your seed phrase — they rely on rushed consent: approvals, permits, and signatures you didn’t fully read.
Lookalike domains and compromised chat channels exploit urgency; always verify the source before connecting.
Broad approvals (unlimited allowances, SetApprovalForAll) create lasting exposure even after you close the claim page.
A separate low-balance claim wallet turns disasters into small losses; revoking permissions weekly keeps exposure short-lived.
